file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 56-20-01-04 - PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Passenger Cabin Windows. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - RE- ALL 56-20-01-000-801-A MOVAL PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - INSTAL- ALL 56-20-01-400-801-A LATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 56-20-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 56-20-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Passenger Cabin Windows. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-802-A/400 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-23-03-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 230 Fuselage center section I 240 Fuselage center section II 250 Fuselage center section III 260 Fuselage center section IV D. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 56-20-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the sidewall lining panel (AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-23-01-000-802-A/400, as applicable). (2) Remove the sidewall lining panel of the passenger-cabin escape-hatch ( AMM TASK 25-23-03-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screws (5), washers (4), and fasteners (3). (2) Remove the panes (2). NOTE: If it is not easy to remove the transparency, pull it out with the aid of a tool without sharp edges. CAUTION: DO NOT REMOVE THE SEALANT APPLIED TO THE OUTER PANE EDGES BY THE MANUFACTURER. (3) Carefully remove the rubber seal (1) applied to the outer pane (2) edges. If necessary, replace the rubber seal (1). (4) With a clean and dry cloth, remove all moisture along the pane (2) edge, rubber seal (1), and frame. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 56-20-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Passenger Cabin Windows - Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 230 240 250 260 1. RUBBER SEAL (1) 2. PANE (1) 3. FASTENER (8) 4. WASHER (8) 1 5. SCREW (8) DET. A 1 TORQUE: 1.4 N.m - 1.7 N.m (12 lbf.in - 15 lbf.in) 145AMM560010C.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 56-20-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 56-20-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. PASSENGER CABIN WINDOWS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Passenger Cabin Windows. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-805-A/500 - AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-808-A/500 - AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-802-A/400 - PASSENGER-CABIN ESCAPE-HATCH LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-23-03-400-801-A/400 STALLATION IPC 56-20-00 PASSENGER COMPARTMENT C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 230 Fuselage center section I 240 Fuselage center section II 250 Fuselage center section III 260 Fuselage center section IV D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) A-A-59173 Grease, Molykote, DC-33 light AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 56-20-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Rubber Seal IPC 56-20-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (1) With a cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean the frame surface. (2) Cover the outer pane (2) edge with the rubber seal (1). (3) Apply a coat of DC-33 silicone grease to the edges of the rubber seal (1) to help install the outer pane (2) into the frame. (4) Install the pane (2) to the fuselage. (5) Install the fasteners (3), washers (4), and screws (5). NOTE: Apply a torque from 1.4 to 1.7 N.m (12 - 15 lbf.in). Refer to (Figure 401) and IPC 56-20-00. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do a functional test of the cabin pressurization system (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-805- A/500) or (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-808-A/500) (2) Make sure that there is no air leakage through the passenger window seal. (3) Install the sidewall lining panel (AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-801-A/400 or AMM TASK 25-23-01-400-802-A/400, as applicable). (4) Install the sidewall lining panel of the passenger-cabin escape-hatch ( AMM TASK 25-23-03-400-801-A/400).
